borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><b>Construction Logistics Plan (Detail)</b></p><p><span style="line-height:115%">Prior to the commencement of the development, a CLP in line with the TfL guidelines shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. This has been requested due to the site constraints, with access to the property from Keir Hardie Way being pedestrian-only, and the controlled parking across Keir Hardie Way.</span></p><p><span style="line-height:115%">The details shall include the numbers, size and routes of construction vehicles, provisions within/around the site to ensure that all vehicles associated with the construction works are properly managed to prevent any unwanted disruption to other highway users, and other matters relating to traffic management to be agreed </span></p><p><span style="line-height: 115%;">with the licencing officers of the council. Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period and any changes to the document must be reported back to the council’s planning and highways department.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p><b>Approved Drawings (Compliance)</b></p><p>The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:</p><p>- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX<br>- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING<br>- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING</p><p>No other drawings or documents apply.</p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;"><b>Construction Environmental Management Plan (Detail)</b></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;"><br></span><span style="font-size:11pt">No development shall commence, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This Plan shall incorporate details of:<br><br>a) the parking of site operative’s vehicles;<br>b) loading and unloading of plant and materials;<br>c) storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;<br>d) measures to control the emission of dust, dirt and emissions to air during construction; such measures to accord with the guidance provided in the document “The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition”, Mayor of London, July 2014;<br>e) noise and vibration control;<br>f) a waste management plan for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works.<br><br>Demolition and construction work and associated activities, other than internal works inaudible outside the site boundary, are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday and 08:00 and 13:00 Saturday, with no work on Sundays or public holidays without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority. Any works which are associated with the generation of ground borne vibration are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday.<br><br>Demolition and construction work and associated activities are to be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within British Standard 5228:2009, “Code of practice for noise and vibration control on construction and open sites”, Parts 1 and 2.<br><br>Once approved the Plan shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.</span><br></p>

<p><b>Cycle Parking (Detail)</b></p><p>Prior to occupation of the development, details of the cycle parking facilities indicated in drawing&nbsp;DHA/307/REV03 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submission should include details of the security, monitoring and access arrangements for the cycle parking facilities. The development shall not be occupied until the approved details have been implemented. Thereafter, the cycle parking facilities shall be permanently retained.<br></p>
<p><b>Time Limit (Compliance)</b></p><p>The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.<br></p>
<p><b>Boundary Treatment (Detail)</b></p><p>Prior to the occupation of the development, boundary details must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.</p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><b>External Materials (Compliance)</b></p><p class="MsoNormal">The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match the appearance of those used at the host dwellinghouse, no.<span style="font-size: 11pt;">30 Keir Hardie Way.</span><br></p>
description: Construction of a double storey side extension and part double storey rear extension to create two new flats; 1 x  2-bed 3 person flat and 1 x 1-bed 2 person flat.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: Sites of Importance for Nature Conservation (SINCs)

constraints_details.result: 30 Keir Hardie Way, Barking, Barking And Dagenham, IG11 9NY
